Modern React with Redux

Master React and Redux with React Router, Webpack, and Create-React-App.

# 

<span key="18525d357ffa4d8ca6b6dc0b83fce237"><span offset-key="18525d357ffa4d8ca6b6dc0b83fce237:0">Getting Started with Redux</span></span>

<span key="7c2e6914c48645c1b01e943376316711"><span offset-key="7c2e6914c48645c1b01e943376316711:0">Redux is a predictable state container for JavaScript apps.</span></span>

<span key="c4745123135a45849f0e9daaa8782153"><span offset-key="c4745123135a45849f0e9daaa8782153:0">It helps you write applications that behave consistently, run in different environments (client, server, and native), and are easy to test. On top of that, it provides a great developer experience, such as </span></span><a href="https://github.com/reduxjs/redux-devtools" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="cbfc6d9c8d78429a99704b2d364ba195" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="466dcdc8e1944c3a96a83a31bf750eb4"><span data-offset-key="466dcdc8e1944c3a96a83a31bf750eb4:0">live code editing combined with a time traveling debugger</span></span></span></a><span key="34c50813232d4e1faa1c41dcd2341b93"><span offset-key="34c50813232d4e1faa1c41dcd2341b93:0">.</span></span>

<span key="4cae59e849324778aa1c93b4c089a340"><span offset-key="4cae59e849324778aa1c93b4c089a340:0">You can use Redux together with </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6e4cd89ee93343ed883385601d4486f1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="aa69e24b39604147b2600622d2326e56"><span data-offset-key="aa69e24b39604147b2600622d2326e56:0">React</span></span></span></a><span key="e761154f749f4eadaee75d827b5a6ee0"><span offset-key="e761154f749f4eadaee75d827b5a6ee0:0">, or with any other view library. It is tiny (2kB, including dependencies), but has a large ecosystem of addons available.</span></span>

## 

<span key="d15cdbcf3a424d6693a0475e121aef09"><span offset-key="d15cdbcf3a424d6693a0475e121aef09:0">Installation</span></span><a href="https://redux.js.org/introduction/getting-started#installation" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="187a9e8114284819b86bff7c5fbf2c6f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="e7e8cecf84c84e6088ff30f58f459f6c"><span data-offset-key="e7e8cecf84c84e6088ff30f58f459f6c:0">​</span></span></span></a><span key="2c06fe0f077a4d4284f3abab3d26e823"><span offset-key="2c06fe0f077a4d4284f3abab3d26e823:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

### 

<span key="45d173e13760442ba52b7ecff0365b17"><span offset-key="45d173e13760442ba52b7ecff0365b17:0">Redux Toolkit</span></span><a href="https://redux.js.org/introduction/getting-started#redux-toolkit" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6f12a77e57b34220b48e00d23be64dd6" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="5463e052095c48ad930f3293b9201d7a"><span data-offset-key="5463e052095c48ad930f3293b9201d7a:0">​</span></span></span></a><span key="b7aae991698a4fbfb4fa36514fde98f6"><span offset-key="b7aae991698a4fbfb4fa36514fde98f6:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="da953fef3bd24eaab2b191e6430cc23f"><span offset-key="da953fef3bd24eaab2b191e6430cc23f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://redux-toolkit.js.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="84fcb14326e142fa976b70e6c5f39065" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="c61ea3da046d45029134820bfb6511c1"><strong>Redux Toolkit</strong></span></span></a><span key="80008a59e15a478e809f51a8d77fde1f"><span offset-key="80008a59e15a478e809f51a8d77fde1f:0"> is our official recommended approach for writing Redux logic. It wraps around the Redux core, and contains packages and functions that we think are essential for building a Redux app. Redux Toolkit builds in our suggested best practices, simplifies most Redux tasks, prevents common mistakes, and makes it easier to write Redux applications.</span></span>

<span key="60676eca81374eca8cdbac87eb0cde85"><span offset-key="60676eca81374eca8cdbac87eb0cde85:0">RTK includes utilities that help simplify many common use cases, including </span></span><a href="https://redux-toolkit.js.org/api/configureStore" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="69afc83b13fe454ab914e3e39c21222e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="09c53848db8c4a12b17b28db327d1da2"><span data-offset-key="09c53848db8c4a12b17b28db327d1da2:0">store setup</span></span></span></a><span key="5874544309a941f0bc13528fac63c3fa"><span offset-key="5874544309a941f0bc13528fac63c3fa:0">, </span></span><a href="https://redux-toolkit.js.org/api/createreducer" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e69c089540de4dce97d3b28fc1454d58" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="5edf91521a4f473895f7f3896388adf5"><span data-offset-key="5edf91521a4f473895f7f3896388adf5:0">creating reducers and writing immutable update logic</span></span></span></a><span key="69e9746c46fb42da88f30c540691e8a1"><span offset-key="69e9746c46fb42da88f30c540691e8a1:0">, and even </span></span><a href="https://redux-toolkit.js.org/api/createslice" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b6dcd81c486e475a90882506d86c5cb8" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="55c913b70ca449f5aa118154368f6999"><span data-offset-key="55c913b70ca449f5aa118154368f6999:0">creating entire "slices" of state at once</span></span></span></a><span key="a5f937f6dbb043f6b513b73d36bc1e79"><span offset-key="a5f937f6dbb043f6b513b73d36bc1e79:0">.</span></span>

<span key="c414b5474e8f47e2886e734dbfb90761"><span offset-key="c414b5474e8f47e2886e734dbfb90761:0">Whether you're a brand new Redux user setting up your first project, or an experienced user who wants to simplify an existing application, </span></span><a href="https://redux-toolkit.js.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ff5b829d9e374f2d8bebd7808716c6cd" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="4d6dcf9340c346fd8390b61ef06f1760"><strong>Redux Toolkit</strong></span></span></a><span key="240b9c2814e84dd8884a667b08ad1ab4"><span offset-key="240b9c2814e84dd8884a667b08ad1ab4:0"> can help you make your Redux code better.</span></span>

<span key="38b50d883d2e4c5e9e384b675486a833"><span offset-key="38b50d883d2e4c5e9e384b675486a833:0">Redux Toolkit is available as a package on NPM for use with a module bundler or in a Node application:</span></span>

1

<span key="ca919cce3c594a5e898f405108a9f988"><span offset-key="ca919cce3c594a5e898f405108a9f988:0"># NPMnpm install @reduxjs/toolkit# Yarnyarn add @reduxjs/toolkit</span></span>

<span key="fd6d20082540442fa09f3d70eda5a699"><span offset-key="fd6d20082540442fa09f3d70eda5a699:0">Create a React Redux App</span></span><a href="https://redux.js.org/introduction/getting-started#create-a-react-redux-app" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="938acd840d66434887f8e55d394bba3e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="a0249dae88994859b57bf296644b694e"><span data-offset-key="a0249dae88994859b57bf296644b694e:0">​</span></span></span></a><span key="40a4b2d44d4c480795bbc8c335ab2ade"><span offset-key="40a4b2d44d4c480795bbc8c335ab2ade:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="9473e67c1f70440f89fff30aeeb6eca7"><span offset-key="9473e67c1f70440f89fff30aeeb6eca7:0">The recommended way to start new apps with React and Redux is by using the </span></span><a href="https://github.com/reduxjs/cra-template-redux" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="572e600ff1d14139b6893e4d8cf9fcda" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="7fe3712836794d019c496d40083b346b"><span data-offset-key="7fe3712836794d019c496d40083b346b:0">official Redux+JS template</span></span></span></a><span key="2e6c03f42b1c4c7d919784f2e6a98251"><span offset-key="2e6c03f42b1c4c7d919784f2e6a98251:0"> or </span></span><a href="https://github.com/reduxjs/cra-template-redux-typescript" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f30263297c5a407694026f627b2e6313" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="41f792961faf4f6094ef198d70e17b23"><span data-offset-key="41f792961faf4f6094ef198d70e17b23:0">Redux+TS template</span></span></span></a><span key="aed31bf05ce149bf8aae874c34954b63"><span offset-key="aed31bf05ce149bf8aae874c34954b63:0"> for </span></span><a href="https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d326677def3e44e5bc1c428272865608" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="73e67cad51af49bc9dbf337c38c1b084"><span data-offset-key="73e67cad51af49bc9dbf337c38c1b084:0">Create React App</span></span></span></a><span key="b6d439ac01bc4fe7984350f88865f874"><span offset-key="b6d439ac01bc4fe7984350f88865f874:0">, which takes advantage of </span></span><a href="https://redux-toolkit.js.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="499e8797beb74141b6487c7cc902c0b4" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="21037aefa2e04eb6b81e6f5b85a07548"><strong>Redux Toolkit</strong></span></span></a><span key="2300528c0a274c11996717c1f5eae68c"><span offset-key="2300528c0a274c11996717c1f5eae68c:0"> and React Redux's integration with React components.</span></span>

1

<span key="f4e3ee97fc9440519e7dfb432f44a2f1"><span offset-key="f4e3ee97fc9440519e7dfb432f44a2f1:0"># Redux + Plain JS templatenpx create-react-app my-app --template redux# Redux + TypeScript templatenpx create-react-app my-app --template redux-typescript</span></span>

### 

<span key="751d207b17b14a8d8e04fee889af728c"><span offset-key="751d207b17b14a8d8e04fee889af728c:0">Redux Core</span></span><a href="https://redux.js.org/introduction/getting-started#redux-core" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="030250bf096e4ffc9979d5e7e080fd7a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="a3fa6875a8314252b49c9abebbdfafd8"><span data-offset-key="a3fa6875a8314252b49c9abebbdfafd8:0">​</span></span></span></a><span key="e69bba2b821b47348c1dd92fa137e0cc"><span offset-key="e69bba2b821b47348c1dd92fa137e0cc:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="e5656a1e26974157ae14cc98d1a65414"><span offset-key="e5656a1e26974157ae14cc98d1a65414:0">The Redux core library is available as a package on NPM for use with a module bundler or in a Node application:</span></span>

1

<span key="8ff0a8c262564b48909052e5599da8dc"><span offset-key="8ff0a8c262564b48909052e5599da8dc:0"># NPMnpm install redux# Yarnyarn add redux</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="f0eb7bdd0a894c15896d486a5851e6b6"><span offset-key="f0eb7bdd0a894c15896d486a5851e6b6:0">Copy</span></span>

<span key="0e7f564d49ee4b5f867b308c72a11fb8"><span offset-key="0e7f564d49ee4b5f867b308c72a11fb8:0">It is also available as a precompiled UMD package that defines a </span>`window.Redux`<span offset-key="0e7f564d49ee4b5f867b308c72a11fb8:2"> global variable. The UMD package can be used as a </span></span><a href="https://unpkg.com/redux/dist/redux.js" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c86e00f174044b4b896dca564b44cad0" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="19c7aeab01c347b081233847221558f7"><code class="r-1vckr1u r-z2wwpe r-uibjmv r-m2pi6t r-1hvjb8t" data-slate-leaf="true" data-offset-key="19c7aeab01c347b081233847221558f7:0">&lt;script&gt;</code><span data-offset-key="19c7aeab01c347b081233847221558f7:1"> tag</span></span></span></a><span key="fc2c9bce363c4e50be535115c81e2315"><span offset-key="fc2c9bce363c4e50be535115c81e2315:0"> directly.</span></span>

<span key="8ec7b3951d784a5599baa1fe54025c5e"><span offset-key="8ec7b3951d784a5599baa1fe54025c5e:0">For more details, see the </span></span><a href="https://redux.js.org/introduction/installation" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ee730b051f1c41ce9392bfa8d56bf278" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="5020a275adf9429ea428c9ade0e1b14e"><span data-offset-key="5020a275adf9429ea428c9ade0e1b14e:0">Installation</span></span></span></a><span key="79a941951b6d427fad6a49e44eace09f"><span offset-key="79a941951b6d427fad6a49e44eace09f:0"> page.</span></span>

## 

<span key="ce8a34d6689c49a8988cdaa677aa4871"><span offset-key="ce8a34d6689c49a8988cdaa677aa4871:0">Basic Example</span></span><a href="https://redux.js.org/introduction/getting-started#basic-example" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0a62c429e1204f45b156b52044544232" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="ac966891be59408693d5a61cbcb412df"><span data-offset-key="ac966891be59408693d5a61cbcb412df:0">​</span></span></span></a><span key="c461c41cdf4c4b88a8aef6a61933540f"><span offset-key="c461c41cdf4c4b88a8aef6a61933540f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="0e66fbc4a367467791b20a2b8507be00"><span offset-key="0e66fbc4a367467791b20a2b8507be00:0">The whole global state of your app is stored in an object tree inside a single </span>*store*<span offset-key="0e66fbc4a367467791b20a2b8507be00:2">. The only way to change the state tree is to create an </span>*action*<span offset-key="0e66fbc4a367467791b20a2b8507be00:4">, an object describing what happened, and </span>*dispatch*<span offset-key="0e66fbc4a367467791b20a2b8507be00:6"> it to the store. To specify how state gets updated in response to an action, you write pure </span>*reducer*<span offset-key="0e66fbc4a367467791b20a2b8507be00:8"> functions that calculate a new state based on the old state and the action.</span></span>

1

<span key="b94e562d638b4d42a327aa7cbc0f5285"><span offset-key="b94e562d638b4d42a327aa7cbc0f5285:0">import { createStore } from 'redux'/\*\* \* This is a reducer - a function that takes a current state value and an \* action object describing "what happened", and returns a new state value. \* A reducer's function signature is: (state, action) => newState \* \* The Redux state should contain only plain JS objects, arrays, and primitives. \* The root state value is usually an object. It's important that you should \* not mutate the state object, but return a new object if the state changes. \* \* You can use any conditional logic you want in a reducer. In this example, \* we use a switch statement, but it's not required. \*/function counterReducer(state = { value: 0 }, action) { switch (action.type) { case 'counter/incremented': return { value: state.value + 1 } case 'counter/decremented': return { value: state.value - 1 } default: return state }}// Create a Redux store holding the state of your app.// Its API is { subscribe, dispatch, getState }.let store = createStore(counterReducer)// You can use subscribe() to update the UI in response to state changes.// Normally you'd use a view binding library (e.g. React Redux) rather than subscribe() directly.// There may be additional use cases where it's helpful to subscribe as well.store.subscribe(() => console.log(store.getState()))// The only way to mutate the internal state is to dispatch an action.// The actions can be serialized, logged or stored and later replayed.store.dispatch({ type: 'counter/incremented' })// {value: 1}store.dispatch({ type: 'counter/incremented' })// {value: 2}store.dispatch({ type: 'counter/decremented' })// {value: 1}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="4bd0bb0d6a0a43a7a2840f9a1f1f9182"><span offset-key="4bd0bb0d6a0a43a7a2840f9a1f1f9182:0">Copy</span></span>

<span key="7b234027eae64c158f0a7a5fe8ce80b1"><span offset-key="7b234027eae64c158f0a7a5fe8ce80b1:0">Instead of mutating the state directly, you specify the mutations you want to happen with plain objects called </span>*actions*<span offset-key="7b234027eae64c158f0a7a5fe8ce80b1:2">. Then you write a special function called a </span>*reducer*<span offset-key="7b234027eae64c158f0a7a5fe8ce80b1:4"> to decide how every action transforms the entire application's state.</span></span>

<span key="8c082f59da0846938eac23575a8020f4"><span offset-key="8c082f59da0846938eac23575a8020f4:0">In a typical Redux app, there is just a single store with a single root reducing function. As your app grows, you split the root reducer into smaller reducers independently operating on the different parts of the state tree. This is exactly like how there is just one root component in a React app, but it is composed out of many small components.</span></span>

<span key="be9683f67d31426cbf31710d1a0d3862"><span offset-key="be9683f67d31426cbf31710d1a0d3862:0">This architecture might seem like a lot for a counter app, but the beauty of this pattern is how well it scales to large and complex apps. It also enables very powerful developer tools, because it is possible to trace every mutation to the action that caused it. You can record user sessions and reproduce them just by replaying every action.</span></span>

### 

<span key="3ab2458cf2ab423cb436a00e3ea6348b"><span offset-key="3ab2458cf2ab423cb436a00e3ea6348b:0">Redux Toolkit Example</span></span><a href="https://redux.js.org/introduction/getting-started#redux-toolkit-example" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="57a133f1d90548efa4764f36191c61ee" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="b96f66e0f37544e580598cb6002fd291"><span data-offset-key="b96f66e0f37544e580598cb6002fd291:0">​</span></span></span></a><span key="94be698e4786402e97bc8f3ba68fdd80"><span offset-key="94be698e4786402e97bc8f3ba68fdd80:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="1e31a47229834ba58f1061f963ddca0c"><span offset-key="1e31a47229834ba58f1061f963ddca0c:0">Redux Toolkit simplifies the process of writing Redux logic and setting up the store. With Redux Toolkit, that same logic looks like:</span></span>

1

<span key="831de82dfbc94659940f815d81a413c0"><span offset-key="831de82dfbc94659940f815d81a413c0:0">import { createSlice, configureStore } from '@reduxjs/toolkit'const counterSlice = createSlice({ name: 'counter', initialState: { value: 0 }, reducers: { incremented: state => { // Redux Toolkit allows us to write "mutating" logic in reducers. It // doesn't actually mutate the state because it uses the Immer library, // which detects changes to a "draft state" and produces a brand new // immutable state based off those changes state.value += 1 }, decremented: state => { state.value -= 1 } }})export const { incremented, decremented } = counterSlice.actionsconst store = configureStore({ reducer: counterSlice.reducer})// Can still subscribe to the storestore.subscribe(() => console.log(store.getState()))// Still pass action objects to \`dispatch\`, but they're created for usstore.dispatch(incremented())// {value: 1}store.dispatch(incremented())// {value: 2}store.dispatch(decremented())// {value: 1}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="1ce3f68114e54cac888c431cbdd4981f"><span offset-key="1ce3f68114e54cac888c431cbdd4981f:0">Copy</span></span>

<span key="9ac462bc2c3d436da51bf0ba5ccc58db"><span offset-key="9ac462bc2c3d436da51bf0ba5ccc58db:0">Redux Toolkit allows us to write shorter logic that's easier to read, while still following the same Redux behavior and data flow.</span></span>

##

<span key="978bda48a62c4eee8291d43b42b93ac9"><span offset-key="978bda48a62c4eee8291d43b42b93ac9:0">We have a variety of resources available to help you learn Redux.</span></span>

    <span key="7c17c5b14d9a43d1b4ee0096e2611d0e"><span offset-key="7c17c5b14d9a43d1b4ee0096e2611d0e:0">The </span></span><a href="https://github.com/markerikson/react-redux-links" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0ee822fcda3b41a6b80ee736e1a400ec" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="2e0bad65988242568d99653ec3738a77"><strong>React/Redux links list</strong></span></span></a><span key="d5b14d6c24be452b90f75f95bde49d28"><span offset-key="d5b14d6c24be452b90f75f95bde49d28:0"> has categorized articles on working with </span></span><a href="https://github.com/markerikson/react-redux-links/blob/master/redux-reducers-selectors.md" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5cb28481abdd41cc9f51bfe812b13356" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="5a721d40a9e3444fa222443bf51bfe66"><span data-offset-key="5a721d40a9e3444fa222443bf51bfe66:0">reducers and selectors</span></span></span></a><span key="092d4fc769e94b4ea6bc85b13df6fde6"><span offset-key="092d4fc769e94b4ea6bc85b13df6fde6:0">, </span></span><a href="https://github.com/markerikson/react-redux-links/blob/master/redux-side-effects.md" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="00447183b1974b2cb85d073d16ef32fe" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="2fc58f7059284b6e8f04618425ae401f"><span data-offset-key="2fc58f7059284b6e8f04618425ae401f:0">managing side effects</span></span></span></a><span key="50fc87931a494da79aa0bb589835f233"><span offset-key="50fc87931a494da79aa0bb589835f233:0">, </span></span><a href="https://github.com/markerikson/react-redux-links/blob/master/redux-architecture.md" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6cd67b8fed864a2880ea895b1fc093c9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="1049e1a16d5e45bb8bf2d571198fab0a"><span data-offset-key="1049e1a16d5e45bb8bf2d571198fab0a:0">Redux architecture and best practices</span></span></span></a><span key="d7932fede38e43e7a16d7f6a958e920f"><span offset-key="d7932fede38e43e7a16d7f6a958e920f:0">, and more.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="30f48390946d4469bfd53fa394fca267"><span offset-key="30f48390946d4469bfd53fa394fca267:0">Our community has created thousands of Redux-related libraries, addons, and tools. The </span></span><a href="https://redux.js.org/introduction/ecosystem" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="691d5b1fe33c42cca0e53a158652de9b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="adc9f377801d4833b63ef5908bf9a52c"><strong>"Ecosystem" docs page</strong></span></span></a><span key="7f9605139da34fbdb83f3c1aacdbdb03"><span offset-key="7f9605139da34fbdb83f3c1aacdbdb03:0"> lists our recommendations, and there's a complete listing available in the </span></span><a href="https://github.com/markerikson/redux-ecosystem-links" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f7fc3b32e5764cc4a7343c5dbc4b2f11" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="5133975dc5074dfebffe20594946d236"><strong>Redux addons catalog</strong></span></span></a><span key="2fec1e01ed7a43db81fadedf9e5dcb34"><span offset-key="2fec1e01ed7a43db81fadedf9e5dcb34:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="6dfd3e999a5a4889b6b7df4e0c64c63e"><span offset-key="6dfd3e999a5a4889b6b7df4e0c64c63e:0">Help and Discussion</span></span><a href="https://redux.js.org/introduction/getting-started#help-and-discussion" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9e52cb4ed31645e7a88964073a9304e7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="2d09ff84c27c4c98b9036a333203f255"><span data-offset-key="2d09ff84c27c4c98b9036a333203f255:0">​</span></span></span></a><span key="9e7e27bf7f4e446b8e2ccd460ab126cb"><span offset-key="9e7e27bf7f4e446b8e2ccd460ab126cb:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="2bef7e6b734c421a8b866aebb36c63a4"><span offset-key="2bef7e6b734c421a8b866aebb36c63a4:0">The </span></span><a href="https://discord.gg/0ZcbPKXt5bZ6au5t" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c085c221dfcf4fdfb8f67eb2a8319eed" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="1ff440162e10488b836bff2d68cfe8bf"><strong>#redux channel</strong></span></span></a><span key="bccb0c7a71c84fc3b63a3620e481a1a6"><span offset-key="bccb0c7a71c84fc3b63a3620e481a1a6:0"> of the </span></span><a href="https://www.reactiflux.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="89c8db48e1df49ceace89a9c266ad0a9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="892ea06fffa54bdcbce9c6d97216ba00"><strong>Reactiflux Discord community</strong></span></span></a><span key="3e1e62e7ae704f4aa8029d0dc7c014ae"><span offset-key="3e1e62e7ae704f4aa8029d0dc7c014ae:0"> is our official resource for all questions related to learning and using Redux. Reactiflux is a great place to hang out, ask questions, and learn - come join us!</span></span>

<span key="71775d3a34ce4a8c9d37fb15bc754b5d"><span offset-key="71775d3a34ce4a8c9d37fb15bc754b5d:0">You can also ask questions on </span></span><a href="https://stackoverflow.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7d20f6512557449e9a67edff1305b06e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="7d49517ca29446d885afcde35b824a8b"><span data-offset-key="7d49517ca29446d885afcde35b824a8b:0">Stack Overflow</span></span></span></a><span key="2e6eb74a5ba2457f8d068a5364ce3b1e"><span offset-key="2e6eb74a5ba2457f8d068a5364ce3b1e:0"> using the </span></span><a href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/redux" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="50dc52fab34b4e7bbb238724a77fae84" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="e128455507a7439c8da82c4918cd5244"><strong>#redux tag</strong></span></span></a><span key="9c8829b34fda4dfdb6bb61d5a2c17795"><span offset-key="9c8829b34fda4dfdb6bb61d5a2c17795:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="91565addb8cc4f319bfa1a60cfe2fc7a"><span offset-key="91565addb8cc4f319bfa1a60cfe2fc7a:0">Should You Use Redux?</span></span><a href="https://redux.js.org/introduction/getting-started#should-you-use-redux" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a3902c7431d44974881e8b14a02f7b90" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-4397_262-4398-240__"><span data-key="b8ed4b9d96d94d0d88956463aa1e6622"><span data-offset-key="b8ed4b9d96d94d0d88956463aa1e6622:0">​</span></span></span></a><span key="9d8a3398842b4ed5914666aa4c722266"><span offset-key="9d8a3398842b4ed5914666aa4c722266:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="745ed2fac66a41b6aabfa2a8a56bf5dc"><span offset-key="745ed2fac66a41b6aabfa2a8a56bf5dc:0">Redux is a valuable tool for organizing your state, but you should also consider whether it's appropriate for your situation. </span>**Don't use Redux just because someone said you should - take some time to understand the potential benefits and tradeoffs of using it**<span offset-key="745ed2fac66a41b6aabfa2a8a56bf5dc:2">.</span></span>

<span key="ee3f5a4d6bc345e584de985c972f0d22"><span offset-key="ee3f5a4d6bc345e584de985c972f0d22:0">Here are some suggestions on when it makes sense to use Redux:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="e45fdc86311042c48f0824e061b0740e"><span offset-key="e45fdc86311042c48f0824e061b0740e:0">You have reasonable amounts of data changing over time</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="b10e310168d54a56a8a64feebf05a23c"><span offset-key="b10e310168d54a56a8a64feebf05a23c:0">You need a single source of truth for your state</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="00bc7976c76c4ada92902d8042ed5c16"><span offset-key="00bc7976c76c4ada92902d8042ed5c16:0">You find that keeping all your state in a top-level component is no longer sufficient</span></span>

> <span key="64b261b195334281a25744291e20f11c">**For more thoughts on how Redux is meant to be used, see:**</span>
